It is lightweight and easy for baby to hold independently. The locking cap flips down to prevent leaks and spills!

Everyday coverage for essential errands Silicone helps avoid harmful chemicals Silicone helps avoid harmful chemicals Silicone helps avoid harmful chemicals A comprehensive and accessible resource for natural baby care What colors does it come in? 4 solid colors and 4 cute prints Aqua, green, pink, navy, gray Aqua, green, pink, navy, gray Aqua, green, pink, navy, gray Features 10 percent of all face masks sold are donated to help those in need Helps baby develop independent eating skills Contoured design fits most high chairs Helps toddler develop independent drinking skills Supports a positive, whole, and integrated approach in parenting Features Activated carbon layer helps absorb impurities and keeps fresh air flowing through the mask Durable, unbreakable, & heat-resistant silicone Helps toddler develop independent eating skills 2 easy-grip handles & wide base for stability Respects parents' intuition, intelligence, and individuality Features Water-resistant outer layer and wicking lining Suction cup base with easy-release tab keeps plate in place. Raised edges contain messes Durable, unbreakable, & heat-resistant silicone Presents tried and true traditional ideas in a contemporary way Features Structured, lightweight, and breathable design 3 divided sections separate & portion foods for balanced meals Grows with baby-use as plate, placemat, or for creative play Slip resistant Includes vibrant color designs in accessible format

Our Guiding Principles Pioneering safer materials for health and wellness We believe that it is our responsibility to monitor quality standards. For over 30 years we have placed importance on using natural materials, as well as avoiding potentially harmful substances in all of our products. Designing from the babies perspective for whole development We see from the baby’s perspective in terms of comfort and movement. We offer age-appropriate features needed to support the different stages from newborn to three years old. Our Pathways of Whole Learning stimulate babies with seven different kinds of developmental learning experiences. Supporting parenting naturally with ease We provide practical comfort for babies and convenience for parents. Our products are designed to be fundamentally useful and effective with multiple, unique functions. Minimizing our impact for future generations We always consider maximizing the life cycle of our products and minimizing their environmental impact. As much as possible, we strive to source materials that are renewable, recycled, or recyclable for our products.

Mothers pioneering healthy & safe baby products since 1982 'More than 40 years ago, I was introduced to a holistic way of understanding the world that has profoundly influenced how I have raised my children. Back then, words like organic and locally grown were neither mainstream nor commonplace. Today, happily, parents have a myriad of choices for keeping their children healthy. I relied on these principles as I raised my two daughters and as I founded my company.' —Becky Cannon, Founder and President of green sprouts and i play., and Author of Grow Healthy. Grow Happy. The Whole Baby Guide Today, Becky, Emi, and Mari are the mother-daughter owners of i play. and green sprouts, and they continue to focus on creating the best baby products for families. A lot has changed in the last three decades, but one thing has never changed: the commitment to the health and happiness of babies throughout every stage of development.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 15, 2015
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome water bottle for toddlers!
reviews.reviewText: Our favorite straw cup by far! I have 16-month-old twins and they use these bottles for water for every meal/snack. They are super cute but also very user-friendly. I love that they are clear so you can see how much liquid is inside, and absolutely LOVE the ounce-markings on the side. They hold quite a bit and are very hardy, as they have survived MANY (and I mean A LOT) throws/drops on the ground. The cute little design on the bottle has also held up very well to numerous hand-washings every day. They are leak-proof when the lid is closed, and I love that it's a one-piece lid that is easy to clean and great for travel/outings. The straw comes in 2 pieces, so there are a total of 4 parts to wash--bottle, lid, and 2 straw parts. It sounds like a lot but it's not that bad at all. It also comes with an extra straw top in case your kid chews the first piece to oblivion (I haven't had to use the spare part yet). The straw is fairly narrow but the standard straw brush for sippy cups should be sufficient. I just dismantle and throw all the parts in warm soapy water to soak at the end of the day and it works very well (but keep in mind I use these only for water--other liquids might need more of a scrub). No handles, but my 16-month-olds have been using these since before they turned 1, and they haven't had any problems holding them. Sometimes water will come spewing out of the straw after the cup has been stored with the lid closed for a while, but this wasn't a big deal for me--the other features of the cup have heavily outweighed that little nitpick for me (but again--this is no big deal for water but milk or juice might be a different story for others). Love Green Sprouts products.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars PERFECT straw cup for my baby
reviews.reviewText: This is the third or fourth straw cup my baby has tried, and it's the only one he's had success with! This cup doesn't restrict water flow like other cups, so it's easy to get water out of. The straw is also thin enough that my baby doesn't get too much all at once. He started using this one at around 10 months, but I wish I would have found it sooner!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Easy Flowing Bottle for Babies
reviews.reviewText: We do mostly BLW with our 8 month old. I wanted to skip the sippy cup phase and teach him how to use a straw. He already wants to sip from my adult water tumbler, so I didn’t want a bottle that restricts the flow. How will babies learn if they struggle to get the liquid out? Sure babies will make a mess with it more free flowing, but this is exactly what I wanted. I figured he will simply learn quicker this way.We taught our son at 7 months how to use a straw with the honey bear squeeze cups. We then moved to this one, and he instantly picked up on how to drink from it (you can’t squeeze it). I didn’t want anything that was “leak proof” because I didn’t want my son to have to bite down or suck hard in order to drink.Another pro is that it is very few pieces so it’s relatively easy to clean. It holds quite a bit compared to some others. Since he’s so young we don’t give him very much, but once he can have more water it’ll be nice to have. I also love that the ounces are marked on the side. This is especially helpful since he’s so young, and we do track how much we give him since milk is still his main source of nutrition.I also think the simple design is cute. I prefer more simple/minimal designs, and a lot of children’s products are way over the top.Since my son is quite young he still struggles a bit to hold it himself, but he is learning. There is a small dip in the middle to help them hold it easier.We plan to eventually get the green one for milk/juice and keep this one just for water. I highly recommend!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2018
reviews.reviewText: Love love love! My 19 month old drinks more water with this sippy than with others! I love that it’s easy to clean, and clear so you can see how much is left. Only complaint is it leaks a bit when tipped- although it may just be how I have it put together. We currently use it for our 19 month old with the tippy straw option although it comes with the normal straw option as well. Great price on amazon- especially for the blue whale cup.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 13, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great straw bottle with easy flip top
reviews.reviewText: Great straw bottle with easy flip top. It’s easy enough for my 10 month old to hold and holds 10oz which is great. Found a great YouTube video about how to get my baby to learn to use a straw and he was using this bottle within 10 minutes.It leaks when the flip top is open and knocked over which with a baby happens frequently but no leaks when fliptop closed.You have to have a very thin cleaning brush to clean the inside of the straw - that’s the only thing that fits.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Finally! A straw cup that’s easy to sip!
reviews.reviewText: I am trying to avoid traditional Sippy cups for the reasons everyone knows. My 11 month old does well with the munchkin 360 but I wanted to get him on straws before we have to transition off his bottles. I tried SO many straw cups and he couldn’t really figure them out, I think because they took too much work to suck because of the ‘spill proof’ features. It was hard to find a cup that wasn’t totally open but also easy to suck! This works great! Getting another! Also easy to clean, and it barely leaks even when the straw is open since the liquid moves away from the bottom of the straw when it’s upside down- fab so far!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The best cup - better than transition sippy cups
reviews.reviewText: Received our first one as a gift and my daughter has taken to the straw very well. She started drinking from it very early (maybe 6-7 months) and people were surprised she could use it so well at such a young age. I think the design makes it possible for babies to learn to drink through a straw. She prefers this cup over the transition sippy cups with the silicone tops. We left ours at a restaurant so I immediately order two more! I love that you can close the top and that it comes with an extra straw piece. I'm surprised more people haven't tried or reviewed this cup!Tip: when putting the straw back into the cap, push it in and then PULL it from the top and it will snap right back in. Maybe this is obvious to some but wanted to share :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good for a one year old instead of a sippy cup
reviews.reviewText: We transitioned our one year old from the bottle to this straw cup without a problem. It does leak when tipped over and the straw is too narrow for brushes so make sure to wash quickly so nothing builds up.
